channel.title: Introduction to GIS for public health on GIS, maps + data @ Harvard Library
channel.description: Recent content in Introduction to GIS for public health on GIS, maps + data @ Harvard Library

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Workshop objectives and outline In this course, you will learn: Activity Number Competency Sample Data Introduction [add link] Cover workshop housekeeping; Introduce QGIS software; Understand GIS relevancy to public health N/A Workshop requirements No prior geospatial knowledge is required for this workshop This workshop does not require any specialized software to participate, other than a standard web browser (Chrome, Firefox, etc.) Each competency covered will have practical GIS applications live demonstrated by the instructor.

item.title: 1. Searching for and understanding data
item.description: Where did we find it? Looking at source Looking at the TRI metadata for metadata discussion Look at them both in HGL [] [] [] images for these records when they’re available

item.title: 2. Opening and understanding GIS files
item.description: Look at the EJ pop data to understand: the structure of the files (like people open them and look at them) the codes to use

item.title: Visualizing data
item.description: Use canopy (graduated) and EJ pop (categorical) to demo diff kinds of maps Show split screen thing if time
